sub_title: Management | Clinical trails | Public Health | Antimicrobial Resistance | Epidemiologist | Nutrition
summary:
I am an analytical and enthusiastic health researcher with 9 years experience in international projects and clinical trials. I have good organisational skills, can work independently, have a great attention to detail, strong communication skills and have experience working in international and multidisciplinary environments. 

I am interested in positions in which I can contribute to improving public health, conduct research or lead/coordinate research projects. I am experienced on topics in antimicrobial resistance, surveillance, nutrition and infectious diseases (particularly neglected tropical diseases). Positions that are appealing to me are epidemiologist, researcher, research/trial coordinator or project manager.

Next to a PhD degree, I also have two Master degrees: one in Nutrition and one in Public Health. 

Specialties: 

- Public Health
- Epidemiology
- Research (coordinator)
- Project management 
- Antimicrobial resistance
- Nutrition
- Clinical Trials
- Leprosy and other Neglected Tropical  Diseases
- Food security 
- Neuropathy

certifications.name: Developing a Cochrane Systematic Review of Interventions
Food and nutrition security in the context of HIV/AIDS

projects.title: Proof-of-Principle projects
projects.description:
Implementation of the Proof-of-Principle (PoP) routine diagnostics project for Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance assists countries in building capacity to routinely perform antibiotic susceptibility testing at local hospital laboratories by stimulating the utilization of  blood culture diagnostics.
The goal is to train clinicians in recognizing when to take blood samples, to train laboratories in performing reliable blood culture diagnostics, to increase communication and cooperation between clinicians and laboratory staff, and to collect baseline data on main pathogens and their resistance.

contributors.headline: Management | Clinical trails | Public Health | Antimicrobial Resistance | Epidemiologist | Nutrition

projects.title: Comparing the diagnostic accuracy of five tests for early detection of leprosy neuropathy in field settings
projects.description:
During this project I was responsible for the design of the study, logistical operations, communication with the research site, training and overseeing the data collection and data analysis.
Through a literature search I identified five tests that appeared to be appropriate for field testing of early neuropathy: the Neuropad®, Vibratip™, NC-Stat®DPNCheck™, NeuroQuick and the Thermal Sensibility Tester (TST), assessing respectively sweat function, vibration sensation, nerve conduction, cold sensation and warm sensation. We compared the results of these five tests with reference standard tests in leprosy patients in Bangladesh.

contributors.headline: Management | Clinical trails | Public Health | Antimicrobial Resistance | Epidemiologist | Nutrition

projects.title: Effectiveness of prednisolone in the prevention and improvement of nerve function impairment in leprosy patients
projects.description:
In this project we executed two randomized controlled trials (RCT) in 6 research centers in India, Nepal, Bangladesh and Indonesia.

In the first trial we compared a 20-week course of prednisolone with a placebo in 360 patients with subclinical nerve damage. The primary outcome was the proportion of patients who deteriorated to clinical nerve function impairment.

In the second trial we compared a 32-week prednisolone treatment with a 20-week course in 870 patients with recent nerve function impairment. In this trial we looked at the proportion of patients that showed recovered or improved nerve function after 78 months. 

Together with two supervisors I developed Standard Operating Procedures, trained the staff, assessed reliability of the data collection, monitored the research sites during yearly visits, informed the steering committee and sponsors, and reported results in scientific journals

contributors.headline: Management | Clinical trails | Public Health | Antimicrobial Resistance | Epidemiologist | Nutrition

projects.title: Assessing food security in leprosy patients in Bangladesh
projects.description:
In this project I could combine my two backgrounds: nutrition and leprosy. 
I was responsible for designing the study, develop the questionnaires, organizing the logistics, communicating with the research site, supervise data collection, analyse the data and write the paper. 
We interviewed recently diagnosed leprosy patients during a food shortage period. We found that compared to a control population, leprosy patients have less money to spend on food, have less household food stocks and have a less diverse diet. The patient group had a lower consumption of highly nutritious foods such as meat, fish, eggs, milk, fruits and vegetables.

contributors.headline: Management | Clinical trails | Public Health | Antimicrobial Resistance | Epidemiologist | Nutrition

projects.title: Impact Assessment for London Declaration in cooperation with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
projects.description:
The overall goal was to estimate the health and socioeconomic impact of the ideal situation that the targets for the ten NTDs of the London Declaration are met.

My tasks were:
- To develop a simulation model for different neglected tropical diseases (HAT, VL, leprosy), talking to experts about the scenarios and variables that should be included
- Literature review on HAT, VL, Schistosomiasis and STH

company.name: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment

profile_positions.company: RIVM National Institute for Public Health and the Environment
profile_positions.description:
Worked on expanding surveillance of antimicrobial resistance in Eastern Europe and Central Asia within the CAESAR project, in cooperation with WHO and ESCMID.

•	 Assisted in a World Health Organisation project in Armenia to set up a proper Antimicrobial 
  Resistance surveillance system: Finalising protocol, designed data entry system, provided training, worked in an international multidisciplinary team.
•	Analysed and reported data on the pilot project in Georgia. This resulted in an official WHO report 
  http://www.euro.who.int/__data/assets/pdf_file/0007/357199/POP-Georgia-2017-eng.pdf?ua=1
•	 Participated in analyses for the annual Central Asian and Eastern European Surveillance of 
   Antimicrobial Resistance (CAESAR) network report
•	 Revised the manual for new countries wanting to join the CAESAR network
profile_positions.title: Epidemiologist

profile_positions.description:
Thesis: Risk factors, early detection and treatment of leprosy neuropathy

As a Ph.D candidate I was involved in the TENLEP trial to investigate the effect of steroids on nerve damage in leprosy patients. In cooperation with the Royal Tropical Institute and the Netherlands Leprosy Relief.

•	Responsible for two multi-centre drug trial with 1200 patients in four Asian countries together 
        with two supervisors
•	Regularly visited the research centers to monitor the project progress, give training and    
        support the local staff
•	Involved in developing research protocols, getting ethical permission, develop and check 
        adherence to Standard Operating Procedures, performed reliability studies
•	Independently designed and managed three sub-studies in the research centers
•	Supervised master students during their international projects
